data.value: The coefficient of variation is the standard deviation divided by the mean.  This function is equivalent to:
is 0, but many definitions of the coefficient of variation use the square root of the unbiased sample variance for the sample standard deviation, which corresponds to
The function does not take the absolute value of the mean of the data, so the return value is negative if the mean is negative.
There are several edge cases that are handled without generating a warning:
If both the mean and the standard deviation are zero,
If the mean is zero and the standard deviation is nonzero,
If the input has length zero (either because the array has zero   length, or all the input values are
